panels.description: Number of running pods displayed during the specified time

targets.query: SELECT  last("value") FROM /^logging\.pods_running$/ WHERE namespace = '$namespace' AND service_name = 'logging-fluentd' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM /^logging\.plugins\.(.+)\.retry_count$/ WHERE namespace = '$namespace' AND service_name = 'logging-fluentd' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "pod" fill(null)

panels.title: Total retries/s

panels.description: Number of retry to restart plugin displayed during the specified time. A large number of retry is bad

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM /^logging\.plugins\.(.+)\.retry_count$/ WHERE namespace = '$namespace' AND service_name = 'logging-fluentd' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "pod" fill(null)

panels.title: Total errors/s

panels.description:
Show total `OOM` events received by `CRI` for all FluentD pods in selected namespace. This metric means that workers inside the FluentD restarted with `OOM`. 

Non zero values means that workers tried to allocate more memory that available. Most probably need to decrease the buffer size or increase memory limit.

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM /^logging\.plugins\.(.+)\.retry_count$/ WHERE namespace = '$namespace' AND service_name = 'logging-fluentd' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "pod" fill(null)

panels.title: Total OOM events, for selected range

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM /^logging\.plugins\.(.+)\.retry_count$/ WHERE namespace = '$namespace' AND service_name = 'logging-fluentd' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "pod" fill(null)

panels.description:
Calculate as `rate(output) - rate(input)`. By design output records count should be less than input, because FluentD should detect multiline messages.

But too values may mean that FluentD drop messages.
panels.title: Difference between output and input, rate/s
Difference between output and parsed, rate/s

panels.description: Number of running pods displayed during the specified time

targets.query: SELECT  last("value") FROM /^logging\.pods_running$/ WHERE namespace = '$namespace' AND service_name = 'logging-fluentd' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Input records/s

panels.description:
Total buffer queue size of plugins displayed during the specified time.
A constantly growing buffer is bad

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM /^logging\.plugins\.(.+)\.buffer_total_queued_size$/  WHERE namespace = '$namespace' AND service_name = 'logging-fluentd' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), pod fill(null)

panels.title: Output buffer total size

options.content:
In FluentD buffer contains two areas tha tcan use memory:

* `stage` - with size and lenght
* `queue` - with size and lenght

Schema:

```
input ->
  emit --buffer-->
    buffer: stage --enqueue--> queue  # total: stage + queue
      --sending--> output
```

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM /^logging\.plugins\.(.+)\.buffer_total_queued_size$/  WHERE namespace = '$namespace' AND service_name = 'logging-fluentd' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), pod fill(null)

panels.description:
Buffer queue length of plugins displayed during the specified time.
A constantly growing buffer is bad
panels.title: Output buffer queue size

panels.description: Shows CPU usage per container in pod against resource requests and limits

targets.expr: sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container!~"POD|", container!="configmap-reload", name!="", image!=""}[$__rate_interval])) by (pod, container)

sum(rate(container_cpu_cfs_throttled_seconds_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container!~"^(.*POD.*|)$", container!="configmap-reload", name!="", image!=""}[$__rate_interval])) by (pod,container)

panels.title: CPU Usage $pod

panels.description: Shows memory usage per container in pod against resource requests and limits

targets.expr: sum(container_memory_working_set_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container!~"POD|", container!~"POD|", container!="configmap-reload", image!=""}) by (container)
sum(container_memory_rss{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container!="POD", container!="", container!="configmap-reload", image=~".*"}) by (container)

panels.title: Memory Usage $pod

panels.description:
Show `OOM` events received by `CRI`. This metric means that workers inside the FluentD restarted with `OOM`. 

Non zero values means that workers tried to allocate more memory that available. Most probably need to decrease the buffer size or increase memory limit.
panels.title: OOM events for internal processes

panels.description: Shows network traffic in bytes per second for the pod
panels.title: Receive/Transmit Bandwidth $pod
